title: Interpretive Trail Shelter and Viewpoint
listingDescription: Visitors can learn about the original settlement and view Saint Croix Island from this shelter and viewpoint.

images.altText: A shelter at the end of a trail with views of a river and island
images.title: Shelter and Viewpoint
images.caption: Visitors can enjoy views of Saint Croix Island from the shelter and viewpoint

relatedParks.fullName: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site
relatedParks.name: Saint Croix Island

tags: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site
bodyText:
This shelter is located at the end of the self-guided interpretive trail. Visitors can enjoy seating, a bronze relief map showing historical information about the original settlement, and a view of Saint Croix Island. Stairs lead down from the shelter to a rocky beach.

A vault toilet is available at the start of the trail leading to the shelter. Trash receptables are located at the trailhead and next to the stairs leading to the beach.
audioDescription: A shelter with stone benches and a bronze relief map and information panel in the middle. A view of the coastline and Saint Croix Island can be seen from by looking northeast.

quickFacts.value: Interpretive Trail, Saint Croix Island IHS Visitor Center
quickFacts.name: Location

title: Ranger Station: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site
listingDescription: The Ranger Station at Saint Croix Island IHS features informational exhibits, a park store, passport stamps, a restroom and drinking water during the summer season.

images.altText: a ranger in front of 'ranger station' sign waves hello in front of grey building with green shutters
images.title: Saint Croix Island IHS Ranger Station
images.caption: Hello from the Saint Croix Island IHS Ranger Station

relatedParks.fullName: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site
relatedParks.name: Saint Croix Island

tags: Saint Croix Island International Historic Site
bodyText:
The Ranger Station at Saint Croix Island IHS is open in the summer season. Check Operating Hours & Seasons and Current Conditions for up to date information. 

The Ranger Stations boasts friendly park rangers to answer all of your questions as well as informational exhibits, a park store, passport stamps, an accessible restroom, and drinking water.
audioDescription: A two story grey farmhouse style building with a front porch and gray shutters. Inside, a single room has park store items along the left wall, informational exhibits on the far front wall, and tactile exhibits of petroglyphs on the far right wall.
passportStampLocationDescription: Passport Stamps are available during business hours during the summer season. Please check the Operating Hours & Seasons page for up to date information on hours.

passportStampImages.altText: Saint Croix Island Intl Hist Site Red Beach, ME Aug 15 2021 on round cancellation stamp.
passportStampImages.title: Saint Croix Island IHS
